item.title: Impact of Tax Reform on Corporate Behavior
item.description:
Abstract

In this study, we analyze the impact of recent tax reforms on corporate behavior. We use panel data from over 1,000 firms to assess changes in investment, employment, and tax avoidance. The findings suggest that tax cuts led to a short-term increase in investment, but also heightened tax avoidance practices among multinational companies.

Citation

Doe, J., & Smith, J. (2024). Impact of Tax Reform on Corporate Behavior. Journal of Economic Studies, 45(2), 123-145. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00148-024-09752
